paragraphs.text: Obama's big government policies don't create enough decent jobs.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Friday, the Labor Department is expected to report the economy added about 230,000 jobs in November
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the White House will tout the economic recovery has created jobs for a record 57 months in a row
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Voters rejected that message by ousting Democrats in the mid-term elections
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: quite simply because the President's recovery has simply not delivered enough good paying, full time jobs
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the wake of the financial crisis, unemployment peaked at 10 percent
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the five year recovery has scored only 2.3 percent annual growth and added only about 10 million jobs--a mere 7 percent increase from the recession low of 129 million
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: President Reagan also inherited a mess--high oil prices, double digit interest rates and unemployment peaking at 10.8 percent
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: His recovery, over the period comparable to the Obama expansion, registered 4.8 percent annual GDP growth and created 14.3 million jobs--a 16 percent increase from a recession low of 89 million
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: The difference was governing philosophy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Obama put billions into cumbersome, economically questionable government programs like solar energy, expanded federal entitlements, imposed higher taxes on small entrepreneurs, and burdened businesses and banks with costly and ineffective regulations
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Manufacturing and construction--hamstrung by onerous new restrictions on factories and bank lending--have not adequately recovered
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Today, both industries employ about 1.6 million fewer workers than before the recession
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Lost are many jobs paying more than $25 per hour that once helped undergird the middle class
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Democrats, such as Senator Charles Schumer blame new technologies and advocate yet more big government
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: innovation that raises labor productivity has been a dominant force since the first axle and wheel
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Obama's failures indicate paucity of Schumer's prescription
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: More striking has been the failure of U.S  manufacturers to apply home-grown technologies to more effectively boost domestic manufacturing, increase exports and compete with imports
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: During the 2008 campaign, Obama promised to improve U.S  competitive performance by addressing China's undervalued currency
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: which artificially disadvantages U.S.-based factories, but hasn't
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Since
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the Obama recovery began
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: , the trade deficit with China has increased $190 billion, destroying 1.6 million American jobs
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: In addition to the Keystone pipeline, the Administration continues to block petroleum development off the Atlantic, Pacific and Eastern Gulf Coasts
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The United States needlessly imports about 5.5 million barrels of petroleum each day at an annual cost of $120 billion a year
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: That kills another 1 million jobs a year in construction, petroleum refining, manufacturing, and professional services
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Health benefits costs are about 50 percent higher for U.S  manufacturers than for competitors in Japan and Germany
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Obama promised to do something about that too
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the Affordable Care Act mostly subsidizes health coverage for previously uninsured and lower income Americans
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Premiums paid by businesses keep rising faster than inflation, further burdening U.S  competitiveness in international markets
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: High health care costs, coupled with slack in the jobs market, encourage employers to split full time positions into part-time jobs to avoid paying for health insurance and other benefits
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Seven million Americans, who want full time employment, are consigned to part- time work--often in retailing and other lower paying service activities
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: where jobs are more easily divided among several workers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Workers in finance, technology and other high skilled professions are getting good raises
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: while
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: wages for lower-skilled workers--especially those stuck in part-time positions--lag inflation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Combined with the shortage of mid-skilled jobs in construction and manufacturing, those forces have driven down median family income to $52,120 from about $56,436 prior to the recession
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Families near the top have registered significant gains
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: while
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the majority of families have permanently lost much more buying power than those averages indicate
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Getting America working and incomes rising again requires better managing globalization, freeing up U.S  energy production and smarter, lower-cost business regulations
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Without pro-growth policies, the monthly jobs report will continue to bring depressing news to America's working families and lots of deceptive media hype from White House
paragraphs.label: assumption
